The full text of the document is,

remote parts, usually touch at St. Rellena Island, " for refreshment, & to meet Company homewards bound. "

The contents are the Statutes of Batavia. On 23 April 1641 a Commission was
to codify the statutes, edicts, &c., and the work of the Commission
submitted (? on 1 July 1642) and approved on 5 July
van Diemen, [Died 1645] Governor General, and toe Council of India, dated 1 July
but the beginning of the Code itself is dated 1659. Other dates mentioned are 1629 and 1643. The latter is connected with a resolution of the Governor-General and
indicates further revision after 1642. In the
taken by the higher officials, allegiance is to be sworn to Frederik Hendrik, Prince of Orange. [Died in 1647. See
of such an oath, taken in 1641.]
